description:
Currently  nova.openstack.org  redirects to docs.openstack.org/developer/nova.
But  the /versionnumber sites (http://nova.openstack.org/2011.2 ), points  404. 

Can we get this fixed?
title: nova API version doc should point to Nova developer doc

comments.content:
Currently  nova.openstack.org  redirects to docs.openstack.org/developer/nova.
But  the /versionnumber sites (http://nova.openstack.org/2011.2 ), points  404. 

Can we get this fixed?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~koolhead17

comments.content:
I talked to koolhead17 in irc and he says the bug no longer exists.

I only have the ability to close bugs by marking them invalid, which I have done. If someone else wants to change the bug status to closed, please do so.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~anteaya

comments.content:
Bug still exists.

To replicate, go to: http://docs.openstack.org/developer/nova/object.model.html
In the right hand navigation close to the bottom you will see a link "Nova 2011.2 docs",
clicking the link (http://nova.openstack.org/2011.2) returns 404, page not found.

Anne Gentle will make a decision after the summit how she wants bugs like this one, there are a few, handled going forward. Until that time, we don't have a way to fix the individual bugs. We need a process to fix them all.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~anteaya

comments.content: These docs are built out of the Nova tree. Adding this as a Nova bug as it will need to be fixed in Nova.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~cboylan

comments.content: Confirming for Nova based on the fact that I see the broken link and Clark's comment that this needs to be fixed in Nova.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~bnemec

comments.content: This bug still exists. Following my instructions for replication in comment #2 results in a 404 response.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~anteaya

comments.content: The issue is actually that the url in question is *not* built out of the Nova tree, it's dead orphaned content that needs to be deleted manually by infra.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~sdague
